aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars

Class ProbUnrestrictedGrammar

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars.ProbUnrestrictedGrammar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbabilisticGrammar
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProbContextSensitiveGrammar

    public class ProbUnrestrictedGrammar
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProbabilisticGrammar
    Represents the most general grammatical formalism, the Unrestricted (or Recrusively Enumerable) Grammar. All other grammars can derive from this grammar, imposing extra restrictions.
    Author:
    Jonathon

        public boolean validateRuleProbabilities(java.util.List<Rule> ruleList)
        For a set of rules, test whether each batch of rules with the same LHS have their probabilities sum to exactly 1.0

        Returns:

      • validRule

        public boolean validRule(Rule r)
        Test validity of the LHS and RHS of grammar rule. In unrestricted grammar, the only invalid rule type is a rule with a null LHS.
        Specified by:
        validRule in interface ProbabilisticGrammar
        Parameters:
        r - ( a rule )
        Returns:
        true, if rule has valid form. false, otherwise
